New Records: Merih Demiral scored the fastest goal in a Euro 2024 knockout match within the first 57 seconds.
Turkey's goalkeeper made a stunning one-handed save to deny Christoph Baumgartner a winning header in stoppage time.
Key Match Events: Merih Demiral scored twice for Turkey, once in the first half and another in the second half.
Austria equalized in the 66th minute with Michael Gregoritsch's goal.
The match was nearly decided in stoppage time with Christoph Baumgartner's header attempt saved by Turkey's goalkeeper.
Pre-Game Insights: Turkey utilized a 5-4-1 system to disrupt Austria's playing style, focusing on high pressing.
Austria, despite their efforts, struggled to create chances in the first half with no shots on target.
Post-Match Reflections: Turkey's coach Vincenzo Montella highlighted the team's spirit and the importance of the win.
Austria's coach Ralf Rangnick expressed frustration over missed opportunities and the tough luck in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Thousands of Turks celebrated in the streets of Germany after the match.
The match was notable for the historical comparison to the 1970 World Cup, referencing a memorable save by Gordon Banks.
